p: C. acaulis cypselae ( Figure 1B) are oblong, with 4–6 mm length and approx. 1 mm width. They are brown and are covered with silver hairs. They possess pappus with a length from 15 to 17 mm, which consists of 5–8 hairs stuck together at the base. The thousand seed weight without the calyx fluff is 3.60 ± 0.08 g.
